intro: Cacalia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower per stem. Cacalia uniflora is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
